thread.title: Penn State student Terri Thomas charged with harassment for role in protest at Allen Street Gates
thread.title_full: Penn State student Terri Thomas charged with harassment for role in protest at Allen Street Gates

author: Frank Esposito | The Daily Collegian
title: Penn State student Terri Thomas charged with harassment for role in protest at Allen Street Gates
text:
Buy Now Joseph DiDomenico 
Penn State campus police detain Terri Thomas (senior-broadcast journalism) at the 'Standing at the Gates for Justice' gathering after the protest in front of Allen Street Gates on Monday, Feb. 6, 2017. Penn State student Terri Thomas charged with harassment for role in protest at Allen Street Gates Buy Now Joseph DiDomenico 
Penn State campus police detain Terri Thomas (senior-broadcast journalism) at the 'Standing at the Gates for Justice' gathering after the protest in front of Allen Street Gates on Monday, Feb. 6, 2017. 
On Thursday, Penn State police filed harassment charges against Terri Tiara Thomas for her role in a protest at the Allen Street gates last week. 
Police arrested Thomas, a Penn State student, during the protest, according to court documents. 
Thomas told a person filming her, “I don’t want people to hear this, but if you get me on camera, I’ll break your f***ing neck,” according to court documents. 
Police charged Thomas with harassment for the comment. Thomas also refused to identify herself initially, and gave a fake name — Terry Banks — to police. She received a misdemeanor for failing to identify herself to police, according to court documents.
